thread.title: Stars top Rampage 5-4 in OT, win home opener
thread.title_full: Stars top Rampage 5-4 in OT, win home opener

author: Staff
title: Stars top Rampage 5-4 in OT, win home opener
text:
Stars top Rampage 5-4 in OT, win home opener 10:58 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 | Filed in: Sports ﻿ Story Highlights 
Devin Shore’s overtime goal gave the Texas Stars a stunning 5-4 victory over San Antonio in the Stars’ home opener Saturday night at Cedar Park Center. 
The Stars fought back from a 3-1 deficit to take the lead in the third period, but a goal by San Antonio’s Ben Street with just over a minute left in regulation pushed the match to overtime. 
The Stars tried out the AHL’s new overtime system, going 3-on-3 against the Rampage, and Shore provided the game winner under two minutes into the five-minute period. 
The Rampage scored twice in the opening nine minutes of the match, and following a goal by Texas’ Radek Faksa 25 seconds into the second period, went up 3-1 on a powerplay goal by Dennis Everberg in the closing minutes of the second period. 
San Antonio goalie Calvin Pickard, a top-prospect that played in 16 games with the Colorado Avalanche last season, had 14 saves on 15 shots heading into the third. 
Faksa and Brendan Ranford scored two goal apiece and led the comeback in the third period. 
Ranford started the rally at the 5:15 mark of the third and added his second goal of the night goal of the night less than five minutes later. Faksa put the Stars ahead 4-3 with less than eighth minutes left. 
The Rampage pulled their goalie to add an extra attacker in the closing minutes and Street scored with one minute, eight seconds left in regulation.
